GO HERE!  Anthony Bourdain would love this place.   Maybe he's been?   You walk in and it looks like a seafood market.  Extremely fresh fish, some still alive.  Order by the pound or tell them how many people are in your party, then seat yourself and wait for them to call your number.  Don't be intimidated when you walk in.  They'll help you.  Theyll even tell you (in English or Spanish) ehat you should order, how much you should order and how it's best prepared - red sauce, garlic butter parsley sauce, or fried.  There were 2 of us and we ordered grilled Calamari, shrimp, seared rare tuna and razor clams (the best!) all in parsley sauce.  We also had fresh oysters and crab (served cold), and we split a soup (they recommended it).  Make sure to order bread to eat with the sauce.  Our only regret was not ordering something with the red sauce.  We may have to go back.
